Wang Jingyi 王竟亦

Hello world!

03 Apr 2020

I’m a research fellow with Prof. Dong Jin Song at School of Computing, National University of Singapore. I also work closely with Prof. Sun Jun. I received my Ph.D. from Information Systems Technology and Design, Singapore University of Technology and Design in March 2018 under the supervision of Prof. Sun Jun and B.E. in information engineering from Xi’an Jiaotong University in July 2013.

Research Interest

I’m interested in problems in the junction of formal methods, software engineering, security and machine learning. In particular, my current research interests are focused on building trustworthy Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems and cyber-physical systems (CPS) using techniques like testing and verification. Google Scholar

Contact me via gmail:wangjyee

News:

  • [Dec 2019] One paper entitled White-box Fairness Testing through Adversarial Sampling is accepted by ICSE 2020.
  • [May 2019] I attended ICSE 2019 at Montreal, Canada and presented our work Adversarial Sample Detection for Deep Neural Networks through Model Mutation Testing. [slide, code]
  • [Dec 2018] Our paper Adversarial Sample Detection for Deep Neural Networks through Model Mutation Testing is accepted by ICSE 2019. [arXiv]
  • [Dec 2018] Our paper Automatically ‘Verifying’ Discrete-Time Complex Systems through Learning, Abstraction and Refinement is accepted by IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering (TSE). [early access]
  • [July 2018] I attended FLOC 2018 at Oxford, UK and presented our work Towards ‘Verifying’ a Water Treatment System at FM. [slide]
  • [May 2018] Our paper Towards Optimal Concolic Testing won ACM SIGSOFT Distinguished Paper Award at ICSE 2018!
